snippet.title: A “double-face” bit-serial architecture for the 1D discrete wavelet transform
snippet.description:
* A “double-face” bit-serial architecture for the 1D discrete wavelet transform (Citations: 17)
Francescomaria Marino
Proposes a novel discrete wavelet transform (DWT) architecture which is fully scalable, flexible, and modular. This architecture is bit serial, and therefore, has low hardware complexity and low power requirement. Nevertheless, because of its particular structure, it operates on-the-fly (i.e., it does not require wait cycles between consecutive input samples). Moreover, a very small hardware overhead can ...
Journal: IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems Ii: Analog and Digital Signal Processing , vol. 47, no. 1, pp. 65-71, 2000

snippet.title: Psychophysical and Neurobiological Evidence that the Oral Sensation Elicited by Carbonated Water is of Chemogenic Origin
snippet.description:
* Psychophysical and Neurobiological Evidence that the Oral Sensation Elicited by Carbonated Water is of Chemogenic Origin (Citations: 23)
Jean-Marc Dessirier, Christopher T. Simons, Mirela Iodi Carstens, Michael O'Mahony, E. Carstens
The sensation produced by carbonated beverages has been attributed to chemical excitation of nociceptors in the oral cavity via the conversion of CO2 to carbonic acid in a reaction catalyzed by carbonic anhydrase. In separate studies, we tested if the carbonic anyhdrase blocker, acetazolamide, reduced either the intensity of sensation in humans or c-fos expression by trigeminal neurons in ...
Journal: Chemical Senses - CHEM SENSES , vol. 25, no. 3, pp. 277-284, 2000

snippet.title: Partitioning Conditional Data Flow Graphs for Embedded System Design
snippet.description:
* Partitioning Conditional Data Flow Graphs for Embedded System Design (Citations: 5)
Michel Auguin, Luc Bianco, L. Capella, Emmanuel Gresset
The complexity of embedded applications increases continuously. Integration advances provides a rising range of possibilities to implement a system on a chip. The designers are faced to the difficult challenge to select the right units to implement the application functionalities so that the silicon area is minimized and the time constraints of the application are met. This paper presents an ...
Conference: Application-Specific Systems, Architectures, and Processors - ASAP , pp. 339-348, 2000

snippet.title: Digital Signal Processors for Multimedia Applications
snippet.description:
* Digital Signal Processors for Multimedia Applications
Sergej Sawitzki, Rainer G. Spallek
The expansion of the market for real-time signal processing ap- plications led to an increasing amount of cost-effective hi gh- performance DSP solutions. Regardless of the developments in the domain of general purpose microprocessors, the major- ity of the multimedia algorithms still requires special har dware to fulfil the time constraints. This paper analyzes differen t ap- proaches ...
Published in 2000.
